data.event: Incorporated in 1966, the city is surrounded by Tigard and Tualatin and is adjacent to the Bridgeport Village shopping complex.
Durham operated a sawmill and a flour mill on Fanno Creek, which flows through the city, from 1866 until his death in 1898.
Durham operated a sawmill and a flour mill on Fanno Creek, which flows through the city, from 1866 until his death in 1898.
In 1908, the Oregon Electric Railway established a stop called Durham at the location.
Residents of the city voted for incorporation in 1966 to protect the location from industrialization of its residential areas.
